meanings.definition: The quality or state of being not concerned with material or worldly things.
meanings.sent1: Her unworldliness was evident in her simple lifestyle and lack of interest in luxury.
meanings.sent2: His unworldliness made him stand out in a crowd obsessed with wealth and status.
meanings.sent3: The unworldliness of the young child was charming, as she found joy in simple pleasures.
meanings.sent4: In a world consumed by materialism, her unworldliness was like a breath of fresh air.
meanings.sent5: The unworldliness of the monk was so pure, it inspired others to seek inner peace.

meanings.definition: Lack of experience or knowledge of the ways of the world.
meanings.sent1: His unworldliness was evident when he got lost in the city and couldn't find his way back.
meanings.sent2: The unworldliness of the young intern was endearing, as she approached tasks with innocence and curiosity.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unworldliness, he managed to navigate the complexities of the business world with a fresh perspective.
meanings.sent4: Her unworldliness was like a blank canvas, waiting to be painted with the colors of life's experiences.
meanings.sent5: The unworldliness of the traveler led to many amusing misunderstandings as he tried to adapt to different cultures.
